1.title: The Best and Worst Disney Kingdoms to Live In
1.plot: We can all probably agree that we don't want to live in the kingdom with the talking hyenas.

2.title: 4 Movie Curses with Unexpected Upsides
2.plot: When we can't even play video games to escape doing work, life is truly depressing.

3.title: How to Ruin Your Favorite Sitcoms with Simple Math
3.plot: Grocery stores are better at screwing with your head than they are keeping their shelves stocked.

4.title: The Inevitable Future of Each Superhero Universe
4.plot: Unless you're a billionaire playboy or, like, super-duper strong, living in a superhero movie is like playing Russian Roulette.

5.title: Why Movies Want Us to Torture Adults
5.plot: 90s movies, like Heavyweights and Hook, were great tutorials on how to torture and murder adults while making kids believe all those violent acts of trauma wouldn't leave any permanent damage.

6.title: All Arnold Schwarzenegger Movies Are in the Same Universe
6.plot: Maybe "Toy Story" is secretly about slavery, but when you put them all together, you get an even creepier universe.

7.title: How 9/11 Changed 90s Sitcoms Forever (Friends, Seinfeld)
7.plot: Friends, Seinfeld, and the rest of NBC's Must-See TV sitcoms were the pinnacle of TV in the 90s, then 9/11 happened and changed everything... forever...

8.title: 5 Movie Villains that Would Make Great Leaders (Game of Thrones, The Dark Knight)
8.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

9.title: Awkward Scenes that Must Have Happened in Marvel Movies (Captain America, The Hulk)
9.plot: Marvel movies leave more mysteries than they solve. Like, whose job was it to tell Captain America his heroics did precisely nothing to end World War II? And when's the last time The Hulk was able to have an orgasm? And who taught Star-Lord about puberty? Man, this is awkward.

10.title: Why Time Travel Wouldn't Work For Everyone
10.plot: Time-traveling might be a great idea on paper but, upon closer examination, it's probably best to stick to your own space-time continuum where you can make a BLT without being burned at the stake for being a witch.

11.title: Why Disney Princes are Bad Role Models for Boys
11.plot: There are plenty of discussions out there about who the best Disney Princess is, but let's have an honest conversation about who the best Prince is and which one you would want to date. Or, you know, at least who the best is out of Beast from Beauty and the Beast, Prince Charming, Simba, Aladdin, and the one from 'Little Mermaid.'

12.title: 6 Movies Whose Timelines Don't Add Up
12.plot: Think time travel is confusing? Marty McFly has nothing on a week in the life of Ripley from Alien. Or Nick Fury.

13.title: What Movie Ghost Would You Rather be Haunted By
13.plot: Modern movie ghosts seem pretty considerate. Like, the ghost from 'Sinister' seems like a pretty patient babysitter.

14.title: Which Ghost Movie Was the Best (For the Ghosts)?
14.plot: Which movie ghosts have it the best?

15.title: The Best Movie Hell to End Up In
15.plot: The gang gets together for a frank discussion of what happens after you die (in movies like Disney's Hercules and Bedazzled), on a quest of spiritual discovery to uncover which movie has the best version of being in the bad place for eternity.

1.title: Why 'Back to the Future' Is Secretly Horrifying
1.plot: If you've ever seen Back To The Future, you'd certainly know that messing with the space-time continuum can get pretty messy. Well tonight, the gang discusses just why that universe was already good and messed up to begin with. Join Michael, Katie, Dan and Soren as they talk about the weirdest parts of our favorite pop culture treasures.

2.title: 5 Classic Movie High Schools That Would Suck to Attend
2.plot: Think your high school sucked? Try attending one of these...

3.title: Which Apocalypse Would Be the Most Fun?
3.plot: You should never lose sight of your priorities, even during the apocalypse.

4.title: Why the Harry Potter Universe Is Secretly Terrifying
4.plot: "Well I guess no child gets left behind when you've got a Nimbus 2000"

5.title: How Breakfast Cereal Mascots Brainwashed You
5.plot: Like The Wire but everyone's Omar.

6.title: Which Ninja Turtle Are You? Life's Most Important Question
6.plot: The gang discusses the importance of understanding your Ninja Turtle inner self.

7.title: Star Wars Is Terrifying for Women
7.plot: "We all knew he knew her name."

8.title: Why Everyone Wants to Have Sex with Vampires
8.plot: "At some point we stopped wanting to slay vampires and started wanting to, ya know, brush our fingers across their glimmering torsos until our tender womanhood aches with the temptation."

9.title: Why Batman Is Secretly Terrible for Gotham
9.plot: Is Batman actually bad for Gotham? A heated discussion ensues...the tension can be cut with a Batarang.

10.title: The Best Super Power (Is Not What You Think)
10.plot: The gang discusses which super power is best for everyday life. Also: Costumes.

11.title: Which Commercial Universe Do You Want to Live In?
11.plot: What universe would you want to live in?

12.title: Which Monster Is Scariest?
12.plot: The gang discusses why scary things are scary.

1.title: Why Mario Is a Douchebag
1.plot: The gang dives into the Super Mario universe and the questionable moral fabric of our favorite 8bit plumber.

2.title: If You Could Have Dinner with Any Historical Figure, Who Would It Be?
2.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

3.title: Most Likely Robot Uprising
3.plot: You might as well learn binary now, it's going to be the only language we should know once the robot uprising is upon us. Of course, we could have stood a chance if we knew how it came to be. Tonight the gang offers humanity a glimpse into the future as they discuss which sci-fi robot uprising is the most terrifyingly realistic.

4.title: The Creepiest 90's Sitcom Characters
4.plot: When you actually connect the dots, sitcoms feature lots of creepy subplots, disappearing characters, and plenty of subtext that makes the laugh...

5.title: Why Star Trek Is a Dystopia

8.title: The Worst Lessons by Pixar Movies
8.plot: Maybe "Toy Story" is secretly about slavery, but when you put them all together, you get an even creepier universe.

9.title: Why Indiana Jones' Secrecy Is Terrifying
9.plot: Indiana Jones is awesome to watch, and terrible to be around in just about any other context. We explain why...

10.title: Why All TV Shows Are the Same
10.plot: Even the most groundbreaking TV shows all follow an extremely specific formula.

11.title: Is 007 a Bad Employee?
11.plot: After getting pulled over on her way to the diner, Soren, Daniel, and Michael find out that Katy has a deep-seated mistrust of the police thanks to cop movies.

12.title: The Worst Lesson Disney Movies Teach Kids
12.plot: It's almost as if cartoon animals aren't the best source of moral guidance...

1.title: 4 People Who Force Weird Stuff Into Every Movie
1.plot: The gang discusses four famous actors and filmmakers who do weirdly specific things in all their movies.

2.title: The Whedonverse Conspiracy
2.plot: Katie explains how every movie and TV show Joss Whedon has ever created all take place in the same universe. Is this a bizarre conspiracy that goes all the way to the top, or the idle ramblings of people with too much time on their hands? As always, it's kind of a mixed bag.

3.title: Coming of Age Stories That Teach Awful Lessons
3.plot: The gang discusses a handful of classic coming of age films and realizes that they all teach children horrible lessons about life.

4.title: Modern Rediculous Stereotypes That Show Up in Every Movie
4.plot: The gang reveals a bunch of truly insane stereotypes that modern movies can't seem to stop perpetuating.

5.title: The Terrifying Implications of Jurassic Park
5.plot: You probably thought the worst part of Jurassic Park was all those innocent people and one lawyer who died. Well, guess again! The gang discusses the horrifying implications of creating a theme park full of dinosaur clones that Jurassic Park conspicuously glossed over.

6.title: Which Alternate Dimension Would You Choose to Live In?
6.plot: Real life is pretty hard and awful, right? The gang agrees, so they go to their diner to argue over which alternate dimension from popular films would be the ideal place to live. You know, if you had to choose.

7.title: I Nightmare of Genie
7.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

8.title: Peterphilia: The Dark Truth About J.M. Barrie
8.plot: Katie reveals that beloved Peter Pan author J.M. Barrie was probably a terrifying pedophile who wrote his famous story to basically creep on his neighbor's children. And somehow, there are also jokes in this episode.

9.title: Why Star Wars Is Secretly Racist
9.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

10.title: Why the Ghostbusters Franchise Is the Best Argument for the Tea Party
10.plot: Remember when the EPA agent in Ghostbusters got yelled at by cops and eventually murdered by scalding hot marshmallow blood just for doing his job? Our team certainly does. Daniel explains how Ghostbusters and Ghostbusters II are pieces of weirdly specific anti-government propaganda arguing that businesses should be able to operate without any kind of oversight.

11.title: Movie Epilogues That Would Have Been More Interesting to Watch Than the Movie
11.plot: The gang argues which "where are they now" epilogues from famous movies should've been made into movies themselves, such as Bluto from Animal House becoming a United States Senator and Bertram from The Sandlot getting really into the 60s and disappearing forever.

1.title: Why Forrest Gump Is Secretly Horrifying
1.plot: The After Hours gang uncovers themes hidden in Forrest Gump that make the movie much darker than it seems.

2.title: 14 Super Powers that Every Movie Character Apparently Has
2.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

3.title: 5 Evil Organizations We Wouldn't Mind Joining (In Movies)
3.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

4.title: Why the Friends From Friends Are Terrible People
4.plot: Even character's in non-superhero movies have powers. From having flashbacks to never having to go to the bathroom, the After Hours group tries to figure out which movie non-superpower they would like to have.

5.title: Movies Secretly Told From the Perspective of One Character
5.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

6.title: 10 Terrifying Implications of the Matrix Universe
6.plot: After getting pulled over on her way to the diner, Soren, Daniel, and Michael find out that Katy has a deep-seated mistrust of the police thanks to cop movies.

7.title: Why Movie Cops are Terrible at Their Jobs
7.plot: The gang circles in on what lessons our favorite childhood cartoons are teaching kids about getting ahead in the real world. It's not pretty.

8.title: The 3 Worst Lessons Hiding in Children's Movies
8.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

9.title: The Terrifying Truth About Doc Brown
9.plot: Never trust a man with crazy hair and a sweet car he thinks is a time machine.

10.title: Movies that Are Surprisingly Progressive
10.plot: After seeing Mad Max: Fury Road Daniel, Soren, Michael, and Katy discuss their favorite bits of pop-culture with surprising progressive and feminist ideas hiding in plain sight, like Animaniacs and Super Troopers.

11.title: Why the Jedi are the Galaxy's Biggest Idiots
11.plot: Michael's attempt at becoming a Jedi makes Daniel, Soren, and Katie realize maybe we shouldn't be putting so much trust in the Force.

1.title: Why Sauron is Secretly the Good Guy in 'Lord of the Rings'
1.plot: So ... is it, like, cool for us to wear our 'Team Sauron' shirts now?

2.title: Why 'Big' is More Terrifying Than You Remember
2.plot: All the lying and deceit to your family is totally worth it, though.

3.title: 4 Insane Simpsons Fan Theories (That Might Be True)
3.plot: Turns out the Simpsons are way more messed up than we thought. Like, depressingly so.

4.title: Why the Most Terrifying Movie Alien Isn't Who You Think
4.plot: All the really awesome aliens are really, really bad at being aliens.

5.title: Why Professor X is Really the Villain of the X-Men Universe
5.plot: Rule No. 1 in comics: If a person is bald, there is a good chance they're actually evil.

6.title: What Your Favorite Video Game Says About You
6.plot: We don't even like walking around our own planet, why are game developers making us walk around their made-up ones?

7.title: The Horrifying Truth About Living inside a TV Show
7.plot: Although, living inside 'The Jetsons' universe would be really fun.

8.title: The Only Film Genre that Gets You To Root For the Bad Guy
8.plot: There are no heroes in romantic comedies.

9.title: Why Captain America is the Worst Avenger
9.plot: He doesn't even have a cool name. 'Steve.' What kind of name is that for a superhero?

10.title: 7 Movies that Don't Realize They're Horror Movies
10.plot: You'll pretty much never be able to watch these movies the same way again. Sorry.

11.title: Why Every 80's Sitcom Decided to Kill Off the Mom
11.plot: We're guessing sitcom writers in the '80s had some really messed up mother issues.

12.title: Why Homer Simpson Might be God
12.plot: Wait. Does this mean we're all supposed to have no more than four fingers on each hand?

locations: Bubbling Wells Ranch, Desert Hot Springs, California, USA
imdb.title: After Hours
plot: Four work buddies discuss pop-culture with extreme detail.::Ceaser2
